alert.note: Alert for East Bay Hills; Eastern Santa Clara Hills (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 5:02PM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Alameda and north central Santa Clara Counties through 530 PM PDT... At 501 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mt. Hamilton, or 16 miles northeast of San Jose. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Alameda and north central Santa Clara Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: East Bay Hills; Eastern Santa Clara Hills
